newsitem.title: UK: Showers continue in eastern UK crop areas.
newsitem.headline: Showers continue in eastern UK crop areas.

text.p: Showers continued overnight across the agricultural areas of eastern England, with more coming.
East Anglia, one of Britain's most important grains and sugar beet producing areas, got two to three millimetres of rain between 2100 GMT Wednesday and 0900 GMT on Thursday morning, a spokesman said.
"There are showers there now. There's going to be more throughout the day and more through the next few days," the spokesman said.

Threatened frost has not affected the area. "No frost or air frost has been reported from any of our stations (in East Anglia)," he said. "There's been very little frost across England and Wales overnight."
Britain's Meteorological Office is predicting patchy frost overnight Thursday to Friday, but farmers do not expect frost to be hard enough to do any serious damage to crops.
